variations.name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell vertically against chest with both hands
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Keep chest up, shoulders back, core engaged
Initiate descent by pushing hips back and bending knees
Descend until thighs are parallel to floor or below
Keep knees tracking over toes, avoid inward collapse
Drive through mid-foot and heels to return to standing
Maintain upright torso throughout movement
Focus on depth and control over speed
3 sets of 8-12 repetitions

variations.name: Back Squat - Barbell
instructions: Position barbell across upper traps and rear deltoids (high bar position)
Feet shoulder-width to slightly wider, toes turned out 15-30 degrees
Unrack bar, take 2-3 steps back, establish stable base
Brace core, maintain neutral spine, chest up
Break at hips and knees simultaneously to initiate descent
Lower under control until hips are below parallel
Keep knees tracking over toes, maintain arch in feet
Drive through entire foot, emphasize pushing floor away
Rise explosively, maintain torso angle on ascent
Keep bar path vertical, avoid forward lean
4 sets of 5-8 repetitions at working weight

variations.name: Front Squat - Barbell
instructions: Position barbell across anterior deltoids and clavicles
Cross arms or use clean grip (fingertips only, elbows high)
Elbows must stay parallel to floor throughout movement
Unrack and step back, feet shoulder-width apart
Core must be extremely tight - front squat requires greater core stability
Maintain upright torso throughout - more vertical than back squat
Descend with control, knees track forward more than back squat
Achieve full depth - hips below parallel, knees past toes acceptable
Drive up explosively, keeping torso vertical
This variation requires superior ankle, hip, and thoracic spine mobility
3-4 sets of 4-6 repetitions - typically 10-15% lighter than back squat

variations.name: Romanian Deadlift - Dumbbell
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at arms length, feet hip-width apart
Maintain slight knee bend throughout entire movement
Initiate movement by pushing hips back, not bending at waist
Lower weight along front of legs, keeping back flat
Feel stretch in hamstrings - stop when you feel tension limit
Keep dumbbells close to body throughout descent
Drive hips forward to return to standing, engaging glutes
Maintain neutral spine - avoid rounding or overextending
Focus on hamstring and glute engagement over range of motion
3 sets of 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Conventional Deadlift - Barbell
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes under bar (mid-foot)
Bend at hips and knees, grip bar just outside legs
Hands: overhand or mixed grip (alternating) for heavy loads
Set back: pull slack out of bar, engage lats, chest up
Shoulders slightly in front of bar, shins touching bar
Take deep breath, brace core as if preparing for punch
Drive through entire foot, push floor away
Keep bar path vertical, maintain contact with legs throughout lift
Extend hips and knees simultaneously, finish with hips fully extended
Control descent by reversing the movement pattern
Reset between reps: release bar, re-establish setup position
4-5 sets of 3-6 repetitions at working weight

variations.name: Sumo Deadlift - Barbell
instructions: Feet wide stance (2-3 feet apart), toes pointed out 45 degrees
Bar positioned closer to body due to wide stance
Grip bar inside legs, hands between knees
Requires significant hip mobility and adductor flexibility
Torso more upright than conventional deadlift
Descend by pushing hips back and spreading knees wide
Maintain upright chest, neutral spine throughout
Drive through entire foot, focus on hip extension
Knees track over toes, push knees out throughout lift
Sumo reduces range of motion but increases mobility demands
Common for athletes with longer limbs or hip mobility restrictions
4-5 sets of 3-5 repetitions - typically allows 5-10% more weight than conventional

variations.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
instructions: Lie on bench, feet flat on floor, maintain arch in lower back
Start with dumbbells at chest level, elbows at 45-degree angle
Press dumbbells up and slightly together (converging path)
Full range of motion: lower until chest stretch is felt
Drive through entire foot, engage glutes and core for stability
Keep shoulder blades retracted and depressed throughout
Control the negative - 2-3 second descent
Press explosively but controlled - full lockout at top
Dumbbells allow greater range of motion than barbell
3 sets of 8-12 repetitions

variations.name: Barbell Bench Press - Flat
instructions: Position on bench: eyes directly under bar when racked
Establish arch: retract shoulder blades, slight arch in lower back
Feet drive into floor, glutes and core engaged
Grip bar: pinkies on ring marks (approximately 1.5x shoulder width)
Unrack bar, hold directly over shoulders
Lower bar with control to mid-chest (nipple line)
Tuck elbows 45-60 degrees, don't flare excessively
Bar should touch chest lightly - don't bounce
Drive bar up in slight arc back toward face
Press through entire foot, maintain tight arch
Lockout over shoulders, maintain shoulder blade position
4-5 sets of 4-8 repetitions at working weight

variations.name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline (30 degrees preferred for strength)
Stabilization demands greater due to inclined position
Grip slightly narrower than flat bench to protect shoulders
Lower bar to upper chest/clavicle area
Incline position increases anterior deltoid involvement
Maintain tight arch and leg drive despite incline
Shoulder mobility becomes more critical - ensure adequate warm-up
Bar path more vertical than flat bench
Control negative phase - gravity assistance requires extra control
Typically 10-20% lighter than flat bench for same rep range
4 sets of 5-8 repetitions - excellent upper chest development

variations.name: Standing Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight knee bend
Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing forward
Engage core and glutes - standing press requires full body stability
Press dumbbells up and slightly together (converging path)
Full extension overhead - arms straight but not hyperextended
Lower with control to starting position
Avoid excessive arch in lower back - engage core to prevent
Can press both simultaneously or alternate (unilateral increases core demand)
Standing position challenges stability and core strength significantly
3-4 sets of 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Standing Barbell Strict Press
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight knee bend
Start bar at upper chest/clavicle height (front rack position)
Grip just outside shoulder width, wrists straight
Brace core and glutes - maintain rigid midline
Press bar vertically overhead - no leg drive in strict press
Keep torso upright, avoid excessive lean back
Full lockout overhead: bar directly over mid-foot when viewed from side
Lower bar with control to starting position
Strict press requires exceptional shoulder, core, and hip stability
No momentum from legs - pure upper body strength movement
Thoracic spine extension and shoulder mobility are critical
4 sets of 5-6 repetitions - typically 60-70% of push press weight

variations.name: Behind-Neck Press - Barbell
instructions: ADVANCED MOVEMENT - Requires exceptional shoulder and thoracic mobility
Unrack bar behind neck, wider grip than front press
Feet hip-width apart, slight knee bend for stability
Brace core and glutes strongly - increased stability demand
Press bar vertically from behind neck position
Maintain upright torso - avoid forward lean
Full lockout overhead, bar path must be perfectly vertical
Lower with extreme control back to behind-neck position
This variation significantly increases shoulder external rotation demand
Only for athletes with excellent shoulder mobility and strength
Higher injury risk if mobility insufficient - use with caution
3-4 sets of 4-6 repetitions - typically 10-15% lighter than front press

variations.name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Row
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells, feet hip-width apart
Hinge at hips until torso is 45 degrees or parallel to floor
Maintain slight knee bend, neutral spine throughout
Pull dumbbells to lower ribs/upper abdomen
Elbows travel back and up, squeeze shoulder blades together
Lower with control, full extension at bottom
Can row both simultaneously or alternate (unilateral)
Focus on lat and rhomboid engagement over weight moved
Keep head in neutral position - avoid looking up
3 sets of 10-12 repetitions per side if alternating

variations.name: Pendlay Row - Barbell
instructions: Bar on floor, stance similar to deadlift setup
Bend at hips until torso is parallel to floor
Grip bar just outside shoulder width, overhand or mixed
Set back: engage lats, chest up, neutral spine
Explosively pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen
Bar touches torso - full contact for maximum engagement
Lower bar back to floor under control - full reset between reps
Maintain parallel torso throughout - no upward movement with pull
This variation emphasizes explosive pulling power
Full reset allows maximum force production each repetition
Excellent for developing posterior chain and upper back strength
4-5 sets of 5-8 repetitions at working weight

variations.name: Yates Row - Barbell (Underhand Grip)
instructions: Similar setup to Pendlay but with underhand (supinated) grip
Torso at 30-45 degree angle (more upright than Pendlay)
Grip bar shoulder-width apart, palms facing up
Pull bar to lower abdomen/upper hip area
Underhand grip increases biceps and lower lat involvement
Elbows stay closer to body - different muscle emphasis
Can use slightly more weight due to increased biceps contribution
Excellent for biceps and lower lats development
Controlled negative - 2 second descent
Keep core engaged throughout - maintain torso angle
4 sets of 6-10 repetitions - popular bodybuilding variation

variations.name: Bodyweight Lunges
instructions: Stand tall, step forward with one leg
Lower body until both knees are at 90 degrees
Front knee should not extend past toes
Push through front heel to return to start
Alternate legs, complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Dumbbell Lunges
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step forward into lunge position
Lower with control, maintain upright torso
Push through front heel to return
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Walking Lunges
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step forward into lunge, then step through
Continue walking forward in lunge pattern
Maintain control and balance
Complete 10-12 steps per leg

variations.name: Reverse Lunges
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step backward into lunge position
Lower with control
Return to start by stepping forward
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Lateral Lunges
instructions: Hold dumbbell at chest or sides
Step to side, lowering into lunge
Keep other leg straight
Push through heel to return
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bulgarian Split Squat - Bodyweight
instructions: Place back foot on bench or elevated surface
Lower body on front leg
Keep front knee tracking over ankle
Push through front heel to return
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bulgarian Split Squat - Dumbbell
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Place back foot on bench
Lower body on front leg with added weight
Maintain control and balance
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bulgarian Split Squat - Front Loaded
instructions: Hold dumbbell or weight plate at chest
Place back foot on bench
Lower with front-loaded weight
Increases core challenge
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bulgarian Split Squat - Overhead
instructions: Hold weight plate or dumbbell overhead
Place back foot on bench
Lower while maintaining overhead position
Requires exceptional stability and mobility
Complete 6-8 repetitions per side

variations.name: Hip Thrust - Bodyweight
instructions: Sit with upper back against bench
Feet flat on floor, knees bent
Drive hips up, squeezing glutes
Lower with control
Complete 12-15 repetitions

variations.name: Hip Thrust - Barbell
instructions: Position barbell across hips
Upper back against bench
Drive hips up with weight
Squeeze glutes at top
Complete 8-12 repetitions

variations.name: Hip Thrust - Single Leg
instructions: Position with one leg extended
Drive hips up on single leg
Maintain control and balance
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Hip Thrust - Feet Elevated
instructions: Place feet on bench or box
Upper back against bench
Drive hips up with increased range
Complete 8-12 repetitions

variations.name: Romanian Deadlift - Dumbbell
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat
Lower weights along front of legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Drive hips forward to return
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Romanian Deadlift - Barbell
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat
Lower bar along front of legs
Feel stretch in hamstrings
Drive hips forward to return
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Romanian Deadlift - Single Leg
instructions: Hold dumbbell in one hand
Balance on opposite leg
Hinge at hip, extending free leg back
Maintain balance and control
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Bicep Curl - Dumbbell
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides, palms forward
Curl weights to shoulders
Lower with control
Keep elbows stationary
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Hold dumbbells with neutral grip
Curl weights to shoulders
Targets different part of biceps
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Alternating Bicep Curl
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Curl one arm at a time
Alternate between arms
Complete 10-12 repetitions per arm

variations.name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit with arm braced against leg
Curl dumbbell with isolated movement
Focus on muscle contraction
Complete 10-12 repetitions per arm

variations.name: Overhead Tricep Extension
instructions: Hold dumbbell overhead with both hands
Lower weight behind head
Extend arms back to start
Keep elbows close to head
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Lying Tricep Extension
instructions: Lie on bench, hold dumbbells overhead
Lower weights toward head
Extend arms back to start
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Tricep Kickback
instructions: Bend forward, hold dumbbell in one hand
Extend arm back, squeezing tricep
Lower with control
Complete 10-12 repetitions per arm

variations.name: Lateral Raise - Dumbbell
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Raise arms to shoulder height
Lower with control
Keep slight bend in elbows
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Lateral Raise - Seated
instructions: Sit on bench, hold dumbbells at sides
Raise arms to shoulder height
Eliminates momentum from legs
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Alternating Lateral Raise
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Raise one arm at a time
Alternate between arms
Complete 10-12 repetitions per arm

variations.name: Chest Fly - Dumbbell
instructions: Lie on bench, hold dumbbells above chest
Lower weights in arc motion
Feel stretch in chest
Bring weights back together
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Incline Chest Fly
instructions: Lie on incline bench
Hold dumbbells above chest
Lower in arc motion
Targets upper chest
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Decline Chest Fly
instructions: Lie on decline bench
Hold dumbbells above chest
Lower in arc motion
Targets lower chest
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Pullover - Dumbbell
instructions: Lie on bench, hold dumbbell overhead
Lower weight behind head
Feel stretch in lats and chest
Pull weight back to start
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Pullover - Barbell
instructions: Lie on bench, hold barbell overhead
Lower weight behind head
Pull back to start
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Shoulder Shrug - Dumbbell
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Shrug shoulders up toward ears
Lower with control
Complete 12-15 repetitions

variations.name: Shoulder Shrug - Barbell
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip
Shrug shoulders up
Lower with control
Complete 12-15 repetitions

variations.name: Standing Calf Raise
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Rise onto toes
Lower with control
Complete 15-20 repetitions

variations.name: Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Sit with weight on thighs
Rise onto toes
Targets different part of calves
Complete 15-20 repetitions

variations.name: Single Leg Calf Raise
instructions: Hold dumbbell in one hand
Balance on one leg
Rise onto toe
Complete 12-15 repetitions per side

variations.name: Good Morning - Bodyweight
instructions: Stand with hands behind head
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat
Lower torso toward floor
Drive hips forward to return
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Good Morning - Barbell
instructions: Position barbell across upper back
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat
Lower with control
Drive hips forward to return
Complete 8-10 repetitions

variations.name: Leg Press - Machine
instructions: Sit in leg press machine
Place feet on platform
Lower weight by bending knees
Press weight back up
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Leg Press - Single Leg
instructions: Sit in leg press machine
Place one foot on platform
Press with single leg
Complete 8-10 repetitions per side

variations.name: Leg Press - Wide Stance
instructions: Sit in leg press machine
Place feet wide on platform
Targets inner thighs more
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Leg Curl - Machine
instructions: Lie face down on leg curl machine
Curl heels toward glutes
Lower with control
Complete 10-12 repetitions

variations.name: Standing Leg Curl
instructions: Stand in leg curl machine
Curl one leg at a time
Maintain balance
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side

variations.name: Single Leg Curl
instructions: Lie on leg curl machine
Curl one leg at a time
Focus on each leg individually
Complete 10-12 repetitions per side
